abstract.t: It is highly desirable for VPN customers to be able to establish their MPLS TE LSPs in the context of a BGP/MPLS IP-VPN. In such a scenario, it is necessary that RSVP control messages, such as Path messages and Resv messages, are appropriately handled by the PE routers. This document defines new object types in SESSION, SENDER_TEMPLATE and FILTERSPEC object to establish a customer MPLS TE LSP in the context of BGP/IP-VPNs and describes a procedure of RSVP control messages including the new object types.
